snippet: Merrill Newman was released after a month of detention in North Korea after expressing regret for his actions during the Korean War.
abstract: Merrill Newman, 85-year-old American veteran of Korean war, is released by North Korea and returns home, ending more than a month of captivity.

byline.original: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and GERRY MULLANY
byline.contributor: Norimitsu Onishi reported from San Francisco, and Gerry Mullany from Hong Kong. Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea; Jane Perlez from Beijing; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Merrill Newman was released after a month of detention in North Korea after expressing regret for his actions during the Korean War.

headline.main: American Veteran Seized by North Korea During a Tour Returns Home
headline.print_headline: American Veteran Seized by North Korea During a Tour Returns Home

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
